intro: Barleria oenotheroides, commonly known as the yellow barleria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance. Barleria oenotheroides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
